articles.author: Sheila Dang
articles.description: Messaging platform X on Monday sued media watchdog group Media Matters, alleging the organization defamed the platform after it published a report that said ads for major brands had appeared next to posts touting Nazism.
articles.title: X sues Media Matters after report about ads next to antisemitic content

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia's corporate regulator will crack down on companies which make unfounded claims of being environmentally friendly, and also hold investment platforms accountable for distributing products that don't live up to these claims, its deputy chair said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Australia regulator targets 'carbon neutral' claims in greenwashing crackdown

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Nissan Motor (7201.T) will hike top wages for workers at U.S. manufacturing plants by 10% in January after the United Auto Workers union reached new contracts with the Detroit Three automakers, a company spokesperson said on Monday.
articles.title: Nissan Motor hiking wages at US auto plants after UAW deal

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: General Motors' (GM.N) Cruise co-founder and chief product officer Daniel Kan has resigned, the company told Reuters on Monday, a day after Cruise CEO Kyle Vogt quit.
articles.title: GM Cruise cofounder, senior exec Dan Kan quits day after CEO exit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Coast Guard on Monday said it was still looking for the source of a leak from an underwater pipeline off the Louisiana coast in the Gulf of Mexico that it estimated had released more than a million gallons of crude oil.
articles.title: US Coast Guard seeks source of some 1.1 million gallons of crude oil in Gulf of Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy met Fox Corp (FOXA.O) CEO Lachlan Murdoch in the Ukrainian capital in what Kyiv said on Monday was a "very important signal" of support at a time when global media attention has shifted from the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Fox CEO Lachlan Murdoch meets Zelenskiy in Kyiv in 'very important signal' -Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Live Nation (LYV.N) and its subsidiary Ticketmaster is being sent a subpoena for documents regarding ticket pricing, fees and secondary sales, a U.S. Senate panel said on Monday.
articles.title: Live Nation issued subpoena regarding ticketing, fees by US Senate panel

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The United States believes that Israel and Hamas are getting closer to a deal that would secure the release of some hostages held in Gaza, even as the Israeli military's deadly assault on Gaza City continued and rockets were being fired into Israel.
articles.title: White House says Israel, Hamas hostage deal closer than before

articles.author: Anna Tong, Krystal Hu
articles.description: Some investors in OpenAI, makers of ChatGPT, are exploring legal recourse against the company's board, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday, after the board ousted CEO Sam Altman and sparked a potential mass exodus of employees.
articles.title: Exclusive: OpenAI investors considering suing the board after CEO's abrupt firing - sources

articles.author: Chang-Ran Kim, Jack Kim
articles.description: North Korea has notified Japan it plans to launch a satellite between Wednesday and Dec. 1, in what Tokyo and Seoul said could be a third attempt to put a spy satellite into orbit in violation of a U.N. ban.
articles.title: North Korea tells Japan it plans to launch satellite in the coming days
